newsitem.title: USA: Dotronix sees Q4 revs continuing lower.
newsitem.headline: Dotronix sees Q4 revs continuing lower.

text.p: Dotronix Inc said Friday that it expects fourth quarter revenues to be lower amid a slowdown in demand.

Dotronix said third quarter revenues were down 32 percent from last year because of a larger-than-expected seasonal slowdown in the large screen color displays and the completion of a Federal Aviation Administration upgrade program.
Third quarter revenues were $2.13 million verus $3.14 million last year.

"Revenue is expected to continue at these lower levels for the fourth quarter," the company said in a statement. "This trend could change dependent on timely completion of the negotiations and agreements on several significant new contracts and introduction of new products."
